what: Fit a model and resampling strategy
title: Model and Learner Summaries for mlr3
code: set.seed(12005L) rf = lrn("classif.ranger", predict_type = "prob") rf$train(task)  cv3 = rsmp("cv", folds = 3L) rr = resample(task = task, learner = rf, resampling = cv3, store_models = TRUE) rr$aggregate(msrs(list("classif.acc", "classif.auc")))

text: object (mlr3::Learner) trained model class Learner. resample_result (mlr3::ResampleResult) outcome resample.  NULL (default), residuals, performances, etc. derived. control (summary_control) list control parameters, see summary_control. ... () arguments passed methods. x (summary.Learner) object class "summary.Learner", usually result call summary.Learner. digits (numeric(1)) number digits use printing. n_important (numeric(1)) number important variables displayed. NULL, x$control$n_important used. hide (character) Names paragraphs part summary. Possible values "general", "residuals", "performance", "complexity", "fairness", "importance", "effect". NULL, paragraph hided.

title: Summarizing mlr3 Learners — summary.Learner
text: summary.Learner returns object class "summary.Learner", list following entries. task_type: type task, either classif (classification) regr (regression). target_name: name target variable. feature_names: names features. classes: classes target variable. NULL regression task. resample_info: Information resample objects, strategy type hyperparameters. residuals: Vector hold-residuals resampling iterations resample_result. regression models, residuals difference true predicted outcome. classifiers probabilities, residuals difference predicted probabilities one-hot-encoding true class. hard-label classifier, confusion_matrix shown instead residuals. confusion_matrix: Confusion matrix predicted vs. true classes. Alternative residuals, case hard-label classification. performance: Vector aggregated performance measures iterations resample_result. arrows display whether lower higher values better. (micro/macro) displays whether micro macro measure. macro aggregation, measures computed iteration separately averaging. micro aggregation, measures computed across iterations. See Bischl et al. (2024), details. performance_sd: Vector standard deviations performance measures iterations resample_result. arrows display whether lower higher values better. (micro/macro) displays whether micro macro measure. fairness: Vector aggregated fairness measures iterations resample_result. arrows display whether lower higher values better. (micro/macro) displays whether micro macro measure. fairness_sd: Vector standard deviations fairness measures iterations resample_result. arrows display whether lower higher values better. (micro/macro) displays whether micro macro measure (see details ). importances: List data.table display feature importances per importance measure. Given means standard deviations resampling iterations resample_result. Higher average values display higher importance feature. effects: List data.tables display feature effects per effect method. Given mean effects resampling iterations resample_result maximum 5 grid points. binary classifiers, effects displayed positively-labeled class. multi-class, effect plots displayed separately class. categorical features, factor levels feature determine ordering bars. complexity: List vectors display complexity values per complexity measure resampling iteration. control: summary_control used input summary.Learner. details performance measures, complexity measures, feature importance feature effect methods, see summary_control.

title: Control for Learner summaries — summary_control
text: measures (mlr3::Measure | list mlr3::Measure | NULL) measure(s) calculate performance . NULL (default), set selected measures calculated (choice depends Learner type (classif vs. regr)). See details . complexity_measures (character) vector complexity measures. Possible choices "sparsity" (number used features) "interaction_strength" (see Molnar et al. (2020)). default. See details . importance_measures (character()|NULL) vector importance measure names. Possible choices "pfi.<loss>" (iml::FeatureImp), "pdp" (iml::FeatureEffects, see ) "shap" (fastshap::explain). Default NULL results "pfi.<loss>" "pdp", <loss> depends Learner type (classif vs. regr). See details . n_important (numeric(1)) number important variables displayed. Default 15L. effect_measures (character | NULL) vector effect method names. Possible choices "pfi" "ale" (see iml::FeatureEffects). default. See details . fairness_measures (mlr3fairness::MeasureFairness | list mlr3fairness::MeasureFairness | NULL) measure(s) assess fairness. NULL (default), set selected measures calculated (choice depends Learner type (classif vs. regr)). See details . protected_attribute (character(1)) name binary feature used protected attribute. protected_attribute specified (also pta feature available mlr3::Task training mlr3::Learner), fairness metrics computed. hide (character) names paragraphs part summary. Possible values "general", "residuals", "performance", "complexity", "fairness", "importance", "effect". NULL, paragraph hided. digits (numeric(1)) number digits use printing.

title: Control for Learner summaries — summary_control
text: following provides details different choices measures. Performance default measures depend type task. Therefore, NULL displayed default measures initialized summary.Learner help mlr3::msr. following provides overview defaults: Regression: regr.rmse, regr.rsq, regr.mae, regr.medae Binary classification probabilities: classif.auc, classif.fbeta, classif.bbrier, classif.mcc Binary classification hard labels: classif.acc, classif.bacc, classif.fbeta, classif.mcc Multi-class classification probabilities: classif.mauc_aunp, classif.mbrier Complexity Currently two complexity_measures available, based Molnar et al. (2020): sparsity: number used features, non-zero effect prediction (evaluated accumulated local effects (ale, Apley Zhu (2020)). measure can values 0 number features. interaction_strength: scaled approximation error main effect model (based ale) prediction function. can values 0 1, 0 means interaction 1 interaction, main effects. Interaction strength can measured binary classification regression models. Importance importance_measures based iml fastshap packages. Multiple measures available: pdp: corrensponds importances based standard deviations partial dependence plots (Friedmann (2001)), proposed Greenwell et al. (2018). pfi.<loss>: corresponds permutation feature importance implemented iml::FeatureImp. Different loss functions possible rely task hand. shap: importance corresponds mean absolute Shapley values computed fastshap::explain. Higher values display higher importance. NULL default, corresponding importance calculations based pdp pfi. loss function pfi relies task hand, importance measures initialized summary."pdp" "pfi.ce" defaults classification, "pdp" "pfi.mse" regression. Effects effect_measures based iml::FeatureEffects. Currently partial dependence plots (pdp) accumulated local effects available (ale). Ale advantage pdp takes feature correlations account less natural interpretation pdp. Therefore, "pdp" "ale" defaults. Fairness default fairness_measures depend type task. Therefore, NULL displayed default measures initialized summary.Learner based mlr3fairness::mlr_measures_fairness. currently mismatch naming convention measures mlr3fairness underlying measurements displayed. avoid confusion, id fairness measures adapted. following provides overview defaults adapted names: Binary classification: "fairness.dp" (demographic parity) based "fairness.cv", "fairness.cuae" (conditional use accuracy equality) based "fairness.pp", "fairness.eod" (equalized odds) based "fairness.eod". Smaller values better. Multi-class classification: "fairness.acc", smallest absolute difference accuracy groups protected_attribute. Smaller values better. Regression: "fairness.rmse" "fairness.mae", smallest absolute difference (see mlr3fairness::groupdiff_absdiff) either root mean-squared error (rmse) mean absolute error (mae) groups protected_attribute. Smaller values better.
